                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">No, certainly.</div>
                     <p>Aside to her</p>
                     <div class="line">Speak louder.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">Truly, I am so glad you have nobody here.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Why?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, woman, your husband is in his old lunes again:</div>
                     <div class="line">he so takes on yonder with my husband; so rails</div>
                     <div class="line">against all married mankind; so curses all Eve's</div>
                     <div class="line">daughters, of what complexion soever; and so buffets</div>
                     <div class="line">himself on the forehead, crying, 'Peer out, peer</div>
                     <div class="line">out!' that any madness I ever yet beheld seemed but</div>
                     <div class="line">tameness, civility and patience, to this his</div>
                     <div class="line">distemper he is in now: I am glad the fat knight is not here.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, does he talk of him?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">Of none but him; and swears he was carried out, the</div>
                     <div class="line">last time he searched for him, in a basket; protests</div>
                     <div class="line">to my husband he is now here, and hath drawn him and</div>
                     <div class="line">the rest of their company from their sport, to make</div>
                     <div class="line">another experiment of his suspicion: but I am glad</div>
                     <div class="line">the knight is not here; now he shall see his own foolery.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">How near is he, Mistress Page?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">Hard by; at street end; he will be here anon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">I am undone! The knight is here.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">Why then you are utterly shamed, and he's but a dead</div>
                     <div class="line">man. What a woman are you!--Away with him, away</div>
                     <div class="line">with him! better shame than murder.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Which way should be go? how should I bestow him?</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall I put him into the basket again?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter FALSTAFF</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">No, I'll come no more i' the basket. May I not go</div>
                     <div class="line">out ere he come?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, three of Master Ford's brothers watch the door</div>
                     <div class="line">with pistols, that none shall issue out; otherwise</div>
                     <div class="line">you might slip away ere he came. But what make you here?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">What shall I do? I'll creep up into the chimney.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">There they always use to discharge their</div>
                     <div class="line">birding-pieces. Creep into the kiln-hole.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Where is it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">He will seek there, on my word. Neither press,</div>
                     <div class="line">coffer, chest, trunk, well, vault, but he hath an</div>
                     <div class="line">abstract for the remembrance of such places, and</div>
                     <div class="line">goes to them by his note: there is no hiding you in the house.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll go out then.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">If you go out in your own semblance, you die, Sir</div>
                     <div class="line">John. Unless you go out disguised--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">How might we disguise him?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas the day, I know not! There is no woman's gown</div>
                     <div class="line">big enough for him otherwise he might put on a hat,</div>
                     <div class="line">a muffler and a kerchief, and so escape.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Good hearts, devise something: any extremity rather</div>
                     <div class="line">than a mischief.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">My maid's aunt, the fat woman of Brentford, has a</div>
                     <div class="line">gown above.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">On my word, it will serve him; she's as big as he</div>
                     <div class="line">is: and there's her thrummed hat and her muffler</div>
                     <div class="line">too. Run up, Sir John.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, go, sweet Sir John: Mistress Page and I will</div>
                     <div class="line">look some linen for your head.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">Quick, quick! we'll come dress you straight: put</div>
                     <div class="line">on the gown the while.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit FALSTAFF</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">I would my husband would meet him in this shape: he</div>
                     <div class="line">cannot abide the old woman of Brentford; he swears</div>
                     <div class="line">she's a witch; forbade her my house and hath</div>
                     <div class="line">threatened to beat her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">Heaven guide him to thy husband's cudgel, and the</div>
                     <div class="line">devil guide his cudgel afterwards!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">But is my husband coming?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, in good sadness, is he; and talks of the basket</div>
                     <div class="line">too, howsoever he hath had intelligence.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll try that; for I'll appoint my men to carry the</div>
                     <div class="line">basket again, to meet him at the door with it, as</div>
                     <div class="line">they did last time.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, but he'll be here presently: let's go dress him</div>
                     <div class="line">like the witch of Brentford.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll first direct my men what they shall do with the</div>
                     <div class="line">basket. Go up; I'll bring linen for him straight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">Hang him, dishonest varlet! we cannot misuse him enough.</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll leave a proof, by that which we will do,</div>
                     <div class="line">Wives may be merry, and yet honest too:</div>
                     <div class="line">We do not act that often jest and laugh;</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis old, but true, Still swine eat all the draff.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <p>Re-enter MISTRESS FORD with two Servants</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, sirs, take the basket again on your shoulders:</div>
                     <div class="line">your master is hard at door; if he bid you set it</div>
                     <div class="line">down, obey him: quickly, dispatch.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, come, take it up.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray heaven it be not full of knight again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">I hope not; I had as lief bear so much lead.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter FORD, PAGE, SHALLOW, DOCTOR CAIUS, and
SIR HUGH EVANS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, but if it prove true, Master Page, have you any</div>
                     <div class="line">way then to unfool me again? Set down the basket,</div>
                     <div class="line">villain! Somebody call my wife. Youth in a basket!</div>
                     <div class="line">O you panderly rascals! there's a knot, a ging, a</div>
                     <div class="line">pack, a conspiracy against me: now shall the devil</div>
                     <div class="line">be shamed. What, wife, I say! Come, come forth!</div>
                     <div class="line">Behold what honest clothes you send forth to bleaching!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, this passes, Master Ford; you are not to go</div>
                     <div class="line">loose any longer; you must be pinioned.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR HUGH EVANS</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, this is lunatics! this is mad as a mad dog!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">Indeed, Master Ford, this is not well, indeed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">So say I too, sir.</div>
                     <p>Re-enter MISTRESS FORD</p>
                     <div class="line">Come hither, Mistress Ford; Mistress Ford the honest</div>
                     <div class="line">woman, the modest wife, the virtuous creature, that</div>
                     <div class="line">hath the jealous fool to her husband! I suspect</div>
                     <div class="line">without cause, mistress, do I?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Heaven be my witness you do, if you suspect me in</div>
                     <div class="line">any dishonesty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Well said, brazen-face! hold it out. Come forth, sirrah!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Pulling clothes out of the basket</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">This passes!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Are you not ashamed? let the clothes alone.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">I shall find you anon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR HUGH EVANS</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis unreasonable! Will you take up your wife's</div>
                     <div class="line">clothes? Come away.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Empty the basket, I say!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, man, why?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Master Page, as I am a man, there was one conveyed</div>
                     <div class="line">out of my house yesterday in this basket: why may</div>
                     <div class="line">not he be there again? In my house I am sure he is:</div>
                     <div class="line">my intelligence is true; my jealousy is reasonable.</div>
                     <div class="line">Pluck me out all the linen.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">If you find a man there, he shall die a flea's death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">Here's no man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">By my fidelity, this is not well, Master Ford; this</div>
                     <div class="line">wrongs you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR HUGH EVANS</div>
                     <div class="line">Master Ford, you must pray, and not follow the</div>
                     <div class="line">imaginations of your own heart: this is jealousies.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, he's not here I seek for.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">No, nor nowhere else but in your brain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Help to search my house this one time. If I find</div>
                     <div class="line">not what I seek, show no colour for my extremity; let</div>
                     <div class="line">me for ever be your table-sport; let them say of</div>
                     <div class="line">me, 'As jealous as Ford, Chat searched a hollow</div>
                     <div class="line">walnut for his wife's leman.' Satisfy me once more;</div>
                     <div class="line">once more search with me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">What, ho, Mistress Page! come you and the old woman</div>
                     <div class="line">down; my husband will come into the chamber.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Old woman! what old woman's that?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, it is my maid's aunt of Brentford.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">A witch, a quean, an old cozening quean! Have I not</div>
                     <div class="line">forbid her my house? She comes of errands, does</div>
                     <div class="line">she? We are simple men; we do not know what's</div>
                     <div class="line">brought to pass under the profession of</div>
                     <div class="line">fortune-telling. She works by charms, by spells,</div>
                     <div class="line">by the figure, and such daubery as this is, beyond</div>
                     <div class="line">our element we know nothing. Come down, you witch,</div>
                     <div class="line">you hag, you; come down, I say!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, good, sweet husband! Good gentlemen, let him</div>
                     <div class="line">not strike the old woman.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter FALSTAFF in woman's clothes, and
MISTRESS PAGE</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, Mother Prat; come, give me your hand.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll prat her.</div>
                     <p>Beating him</p>
                     <div class="line">Out of my door, you witch, you hag, you baggage, you</div>
                     <div class="line">polecat, you runyon! out, out! I'll conjure you,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll fortune-tell you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit FALSTAFF</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">Are you not ashamed? I think you have killed the</div>
                     <div class="line">poor woman.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, he will do it. 'Tis a goodly credit for you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Hang her, witch!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR HUGH EVANS</div>
                     <div class="line">By the yea and no, I think the 'oman is a witch</div>
                     <div class="line">indeed: I like not when a 'oman has a great peard;</div>
                     <div class="line">I spy a great peard under his muffler.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Will you follow, gentlemen? I beseech you, follow;</div>
                     <div class="line">see but the issue of my jealousy: if I cry out thus</div>
                     <div class="line">upon no trail, never trust me when I open again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">Let's obey his humour a little further: come,</div>
                     <div class="line">gentlemen.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt FORD, PAGE, SHALLOW, DOCTOR CAIUS, and
SIR HUGH EVANS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">Trust me, he beat him most pitifully.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, by the mass, that he did not; he beat him most</div>
                     <div class="line">unpitifully, methought.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll have the cudgel hallowed and hung o'er the</div>
                     <div class="line">altar; it hath done meritorious service.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">What think you? may we, with the warrant of</div>
                     <div class="line">womanhood and the witness of a good conscience,</div>
                     <div class="line">pursue him with any further revenge?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">The spirit of wantonness is, sure, scared out of</div>
                     <div class="line">him: if the devil have him not in fee-simple, with</div>
                     <div class="line">fine and recovery, he will never, I think, in the</div>
                     <div class="line">way of waste, attempt us again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall we tell our husbands how we have served him?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, by all means; if it be but to scrape the</div>
                     <div class="line">figures out of your husband's brains. If they can</div>
                     <div class="line">find in their hearts the poor unvirtuous fat knight</div>
                     <div class="line">shall be any further afflicted, we two will still be</div>
                     <div class="line">the ministers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll warrant they'll have him publicly shamed: and</div>
                     <div class="line">methinks there would be no period to the jest,</div>
                     <div class="line">should he not be publicly shamed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, to the forge with it then; shape it: I would</div>
                     <div class="line">not have things cool.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  A room in the Garter Inn.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Host and BARDOLPH</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BARDOLPH</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, the Germans desire to have three of your</div>
                     <div class="line">horses: the duke himself will be to-morrow at</div>
                     <div class="line">court, and they are going to meet him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Host</div>
                     <div class="line">What duke should that be comes so secretly? I hear</div>
                     <div class="line">not of him in the court. Let me speak with the</div>
                     <div class="line">gentlemen: they speak English?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BARDOLPH</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, sir; I'll call them to you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Host</div>
                     <div class="line">They shall have my horses; but I'll make them pay;</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll sauce them: they have had my house a week at</div>
                     <div class="line">command; I have turned away my other guests: they</div>
                     <div class="line">must come off; I'll sauce them. Come.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE IV.  A room in FORD'S house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter PAGE, FORD, MISTRESS PAGE, MISTRESS FORD,
and SIR HUGH EVANS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR HUGH EVANS</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis one of the best discretions of a 'oman as ever</div>
                     <div class="line">I did look upon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">And did he send you both these letters at an instant?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">Within a quarter of an hour.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Pardon me, wife. Henceforth do what thou wilt;</div>
                     <div class="line">I rather will suspect the sun with cold</div>
                     <div class="line">Than thee with wantonness: now doth thy honour stand</div>
                     <div class="line">In him that was of late an heretic,</div>
                     <div class="line">As firm as faith.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis well, 'tis well; no more:</div>
                     <div class="line">Be not as extreme in submission</div>
                     <div class="line">As in offence.</div>
                     <div class="line">But let our plot go forward: let our wives</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet once again, to make us public sport,</div>
                     <div class="line">Appoint a meeting with this old fat fellow,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where we may take him and disgrace him for it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">There is no better way than that they spoke of.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">How? to send him word they'll meet him in the park</div>
                     <div class="line">at midnight? Fie, fie! he'll never come.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR HUGH EVANS</div>
                     <div class="line">You say he has been thrown in the rivers and has</div>
                     <div class="line">been grievously peaten as an old 'oman: methinks</div>
                     <div class="line">there should be terrors in him that he should not</div>
                     <div class="line">come; methinks his flesh is punished, he shall have</div>
                     <div class="line">no desires.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">So think I too.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Devise but how you'll use him when he comes,</div>
                     <div class="line">And let us two devise to bring him thither.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">There is an old tale goes that Herne the hunter,</div>
                     <div class="line">Sometime a keeper here in Windsor forest,</div>
                     <div class="line">Doth all the winter-time, at still midnight,</div>
                     <div class="line">Walk round about an oak, with great ragg'd horns;</div>
                     <div class="line">And there he blasts the tree and takes the cattle</div>
                     <div class="line">And makes milch-kine yield blood and shakes a chain</div>
                     <div class="line">In a most hideous and dreadful manner:</div>
                     <div class="line">You have heard of such a spirit, and well you know</div>
                     <div class="line">The superstitious idle-headed eld</div>
                     <div class="line">Received and did deliver to our age</div>
                     <div class="line">This tale of Herne the hunter for a truth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, yet there want not many that do fear</div>
                     <div class="line">In deep of night to walk by this Herne's oak:</div>
                     <div class="line">But what of this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, this is our device;</div>
                     <div class="line">That Falstaff at that oak shall meet with us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, let it not be doubted but he'll come:</div>
                     <div class="line">And in this shape when you have brought him thither,</div>
                     <div class="line">What shall be done with him? what is your plot?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">That likewise have we thought upon, and thus:</div>
                     <div class="line">Nan Page my daughter and my little son</div>
                     <div class="line">And three or four more of their growth we'll dress</div>
                     <div class="line">Like urchins, ouphes and fairies, green and white,</div>
                     <div class="line">With rounds of waxen tapers on their heads,</div>
                     <div class="line">And rattles in their hands: upon a sudden,</div>
                     <div class="line">As Falstaff, she and I, are newly met,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let them from forth a sawpit rush at once</div>
                     <div class="line">With some diffused song: upon their sight,</div>
                     <div class="line">We two in great amazedness will fly:</div>
                     <div class="line">Then let them all encircle him about</div>
                     <div class="line">And, fairy-like, to-pinch the unclean knight,</div>
                     <div class="line">And ask him why, that hour of fairy revel,</div>
                     <div class="line">In their so sacred paths he dares to tread</div>
                     <div class="line">In shape profane.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">And till he tell the truth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let the supposed fairies pinch him sound</div>
                     <div class="line">And burn him with their tapers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">The truth being known,</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll all present ourselves, dis-horn the spirit,</div>
                     <div class="line">And mock him home to Windsor.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">The children must</div>
                     <div class="line">Be practised well to this, or they'll ne'er do't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR HUGH EVANS</div>
                     <div class="line">I will teach the children their behaviors; and I</div>
                     <div class="line">will be like a jack-an-apes also, to burn the</div>
                     <div class="line">knight with my taber.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">That will be excellent. I'll go and buy them vizards.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">My Nan shall be the queen of all the fairies,</div>
                     <div class="line">Finely attired in a robe of white.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">That silk will I go buy.</div>
                     <p>Aside</p>
                     <div class="line">And in that time</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall Master Slender steal my Nan away</div>
                     <div class="line">And marry her at Eton. Go send to Falstaff straight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay I'll to him again in name of Brook</div>
                     <div class="line">He'll tell me all his purpose: sure, he'll come.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">Fear not you that. Go get us properties</div>
                     <div class="line">And tricking for our fairies.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR HUGH EVANS</div>
                     <div class="line">Let us about it: it is admirable pleasures and fery</div>
                     <div class="line">honest knaveries.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt PAGE, FORD, and SIR HUGH EVANS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, Mistress Ford,</div>
                     <div class="line">Send quickly to Sir John, to know his mind.</div>
                     <p>Exit MISTRESS FORD</p>
                     <div class="line">I'll to the doctor: he hath my good will,</div>
                     <div class="line">And none but he, to marry with Nan Page.</div>
                     <div class="line">That Slender, though well landed, is an idiot;</div>
                     <div class="line">And he my husband best of all affects.</div>
                     <div class="line">The doctor is well money'd, and his friends</div>
                     <div class="line">Potent at court: he, none but he, shall have her,</div>
                     <div class="line">Though twenty thousand worthier come to crave her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.6">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>5. SCENE V.  A room in the Garter Inn.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Host and SIMPLE</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Host</div>
                     <div class="line">What wouldst thou have, boor? what: thick-skin?</div>
                     <div class="line">speak, breathe, discuss; brief, short, quick, snap.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIMPLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, sir, I come to speak with Sir John Falstaff</div>
                     <div class="line">from Master Slender.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Host</div>
                     <div class="line">There's his chamber, his house, his castle, his</div>
                     <div class="line">standing-bed and truckle-bed; 'tis painted about</div>
                     <div class="line">with the story of the Prodigal, fresh and new. Go</div>
                     <div class="line">knock and call; hell speak like an Anthropophaginian</div>
                     <div class="line">unto thee: knock, I say.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIMPLE</div>
                     <div class="line">There's an old woman, a fat woman, gone up into his</div>
                     <div class="line">chamber: I'll be so bold as stay, sir, till she come</div>
                     <div class="line">down; I come to speak with her, indeed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Host</div>
                     <div class="line">Ha! a fat woman! the knight may be robbed: I'll</div>
                     <div class="line">call. Bully knight! bully Sir John! speak from</div>
                     <div class="line">thy lungs military: art thou there? it is thine</div>
                     <div class="line">host, thine Ephesian, calls.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Above</span>  How now, mine host!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Host</div>
                     <div class="line">Here's a Bohemian-Tartar tarries the coming down of</div>
                     <div class="line">thy fat woman. Let her descend, bully, let her</div>
                     <div class="line">descend; my chambers are honourable: fie! privacy?</div>
                     <div class="line">fie!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter FALSTAFF</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">There was, mine host, an old fat woman even now with</div>
                     <div class="line">me; but she's gone.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIMPLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray you, sir, was't not the wise woman of</div>
                     <div class="line">Brentford?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, marry, was it, mussel-shell: what would you with her?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIMPLE</div>
                     <div class="line">My master, sir, Master Slender, sent to her, seeing</div>
                     <div class="line">her go through the streets, to know, sir, whether</div>
                     <div class="line">one Nym, sir, that beguiled him of a chain, had the</div>
                     <div class="line">chain or no.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">I spake with the old woman about it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIMPLE</div>
                     <div class="line">And what says she, I pray, sir?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, she says that the very same man that</div>
                     <div class="line">beguiled Master Slender of his chain cozened him of</div>
                     <div class="line">it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIMPLE</div>
                     <div class="line">I would I could have spoken with the woman herself;</div>
                     <div class="line">I had other things to have spoken with her too from</div>
                     <div class="line">him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">What are they? let us know.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Host</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, come; quick.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIMPLE</div>
                     <div class="line">I may not conceal them, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Host</div>
                     <div class="line">Conceal them, or thou diest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIMPLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, sir, they were nothing but about Mistress Anne</div>
                     <div class="line">Page; to know if it were my master's fortune to</div>
                     <div class="line">have her or no.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis, 'tis his fortune.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIMPLE</div>
                     <div class="line">What, sir?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">To have her, or no. Go; say the woman told me so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIMPLE</div>
                     <div class="line">May I be bold to say so, sir?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, sir; like who more bold.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIMPLE</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank your worship: I shall make my master glad</div>
                     <div class="line">with these tidings.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Host</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art clerkly, thou art clerkly, Sir John. Was</div>
                     <div class="line">there a wise woman with thee?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, that there was, mine host; one that hath taught</div>
                     <div class="line">me more wit than ever I learned before in my life;</div>
                     <div class="line">and I paid nothing for it neither, but was paid for</div>
                     <div class="line">my learning.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter BARDOLPH</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BARDOLPH</div>
                     <div class="line">Out, alas, sir! cozenage, mere cozenage!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Host</div>
                     <div class="line">Where be my horses? speak well of them, varletto.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BARDOLPH</div>
                     <div class="line">Run away with the cozeners; for so soon as I came</div>
                     <div class="line">beyond Eton, they threw me off from behind one of</div>
                     <div class="line">them, in a slough of mire; and set spurs and away,</div>
                     <div class="line">like three German devils, three Doctor Faustuses.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Host</div>
                     <div class="line">They are gone but to meet the duke, villain: do not</div>
                     <div class="line">say they be fled; Germans are honest men.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter SIR HUGH EVANS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR HUGH EVANS</div>
                     <div class="line">Where is mine host?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Host</div>
                     <div class="line">What is the matter, sir?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR HUGH EVANS</div>
                     <div class="line">Have a care of your entertainments: there is a</div>
                     <div class="line">friend of mine come to town tells me there is three</div>
                     <div class="line">cozen-germans that has cozened all the hosts of</div>
                     <div class="line">Readins, of Maidenhead, of Colebrook, of horses and</div>
                     <div class="line">money. I tell you for good will, look you: you</div>
                     <div class="line">are wise and full of gibes and vlouting-stocks, and</div>
                     <div class="line">'tis not convenient you should be cozened. Fare you well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <p>Enter DOCTOR CAIUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DOCTOR CAIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Vere is mine host de Jarteer?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Host</div>
                     <div class="line">Here, master doctor, in perplexity and doubtful dilemma.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DOCTOR CAIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I cannot tell vat is dat: but it is tell-a me dat</div>
                     <div class="line">you make grand preparation for a duke de Jamany: by</div>
                     <div class="line">my trot, dere is no duke dat the court is know to</div>
                     <div class="line">come. I tell you for good vill: adieu.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Host</div>
                     <div class="line">Hue and cry, villain, go! Assist me, knight. I am</div>
                     <div class="line">undone! Fly, run, hue and cry, villain! I am undone!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt Host and BARDOLPH</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">I would all the world might be cozened; for I have</div>
                     <div class="line">been cozened and beaten too. If it should come to</div>
                     <div class="line">the ear of the court, how I have been transformed</div>
                     <div class="line">and how my transformation hath been washed and</div>
                     <div class="line">cudgelled, they would melt me out of my fat drop by</div>
                     <div class="line">drop and liquor fishermen's boots with me; I warrant</div>
                     <div class="line">they would whip me with their fine wits till I were</div>
                     <div class="line">as crest-fallen as a dried pear. I never prospered</div>
                     <div class="line">since I forswore myself at primero. Well, if my</div>
                     <div class="line">wind were but long enough to say my prayers, I would repent.</div>
                     <p>Enter MISTRESS QUICKLY</p>
                     <div class="line">Now, whence come you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS QUICKLY</div>
                     <div class="line">From the two parties, forsooth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">The devil take one party and his dam the other! and</div>
                     <div class="line">so they shall be both bestowed. I have suffered more</div>
                     <div class="line">for their sakes, more than the villanous inconstancy</div>
                     <div class="line">of man's disposition is able to bear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS QUICKLY</div>
                     <div class="line">And have not they suffered? Yes, I warrant;</div>
                     <div class="line">speciously one of them; Mistress Ford, good heart,</div>
                     <div class="line">is beaten black and blue, that you cannot see a</div>
                     <div class="line">white spot about her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">What tellest thou me of black and blue? I was</div>
                     <div class="line">beaten myself into all the colours of the rainbow;</div>
                     <div class="line">and I was like to be apprehended for the witch of</div>
                     <div class="line">Brentford: but that my admirable dexterity of wit,</div>
                     <div class="line">my counterfeiting the action of an old woman,</div>
                     <div class="line">delivered me, the knave constable had set me i' the</div>
                     <div class="line">stocks, i' the common stocks, for a witch.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS QUICKLY</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, let me speak with you in your chamber: you</div>
                     <div class="line">shall hear how things go; and, I warrant, to your</div>
                     <div class="line">content. Here is a letter will say somewhat. Good</div>
                     <div class="line">hearts, what ado here is to bring you together!</div>
                     <div class="line">Sure, one of you does not serve heaven well, that</div>
                     <div class="line">you are so crossed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Come up into my chamber.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.7">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>6. SCENE VI.  Another room in the Garter Inn.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter FENTON and Host</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Host</div>
                     <div class="line">Master Fenton, talk not to me; my mind is heavy: I</div>
                     <div class="line">will give over all.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FENTON</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet hear me speak. Assist me in my purpose,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, as I am a gentleman, I'll give thee</div>
                     <div class="line">A hundred pound in gold more than your loss.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Host</div>
                     <div class="line">I will hear you, Master Fenton; and I will at the</div>
                     <div class="line">least keep your counsel.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FENTON</div>
                     <div class="line">From time to time I have acquainted you</div>
                     <div class="line">With the dear love I bear to fair Anne Page;</div>
                     <div class="line">Who mutually hath answer'd my affection,</div>
                     <div class="line">So far forth as herself might be her chooser,</div>
                     <div class="line">Even to my wish: I have a letter from her</div>
                     <div class="line">Of such contents as you will wonder at;</div>
                     <div class="line">The mirth whereof so larded with my matter,</div>
                     <div class="line">That neither singly can be manifested,</div>
                     <div class="line">Without the show of both; fat Falstaff</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath a great scene: the image of the jest</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll show you here at large. Hark, good mine host.</div>
                     <div class="line">To-night at Herne's oak, just 'twixt twelve and one,</div>
                     <div class="line">Must my sweet Nan present the Fairy Queen;</div>
                     <div class="line">The purpose why, is here: in which disguise,</div>
                     <div class="line">While other jests are something rank on foot,</div>
                     <div class="line">Her father hath commanded her to slip</div>
                     <div class="line">Away with Slender and with him at Eton</div>
                     <div class="line">Immediately to marry: she hath consented: Now, sir,</div>
                     <div class="line">Her mother, ever strong against that match</div>
                     <div class="line">And firm for Doctor Caius, hath appointed</div>
                     <div class="line">That he shall likewise shuffle her away,</div>
                     <div class="line">While other sports are tasking of their minds,</div>
                     <div class="line">And at the deanery, where a priest attends,</div>
                     <div class="line">Straight marry her: to this her mother's plot</div>
                     <div class="line">She seemingly obedient likewise hath</div>
                     <div class="line">Made promise to the doctor. Now, thus it rests:</div>
                     <div class="line">Her father means she shall be all in white,</div>
                     <div class="line">And in that habit, when Slender sees his time</div>
                     <div class="line">To take her by the hand and bid her go,</div>
                     <div class="line">She shall go with him: her mother hath intended,</div>
                     <div class="line">The better to denote her to the doctor,</div>
                     <div class="line">For they must all be mask'd and vizarded,</div>
                     <div class="line">That quaint in green she shall be loose enrobed,</div>
                     <div class="line">With ribands pendent, flaring 'bout her head;</div>
                     <div class="line">And when the doctor spies his vantage ripe,</div>
                     <div class="line">To pinch her by the hand, and, on that token,</div>
                     <div class="line">The maid hath given consent to go with him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Host</div>
                     <div class="line">Which means she to deceive, father or mother?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FENTON</div>
                     <div class="line">Both, my good host, to go along with me:</div>
                     <div class="line">And here it rests, that you'll procure the vicar</div>
                     <div class="line">To stay for me at church 'twixt twelve and one,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, in the lawful name of marrying,</div>
                     <div class="line">To give our hearts united ceremony.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Host</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, husband your device; I'll to the vicar:</div>
                     <div class="line">Bring you the maid, you shall not lack a priest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FENTON</div>
                     <div class="line">So shall I evermore be bound to thee;</div>
                     <div class="line">Besides, I'll make a present recompense.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.7">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 5. ACT V</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.2">1. SCENE I.  A room in the Garter Inn.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.3">2. SCENE II.  Windsor Park.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.4">3. SCENE III.  A street leading to the Park.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.5">4. SCENE IV.  Windsor Park.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.6">5. SCENE V.  Another part of the Park.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  A room in the Garter Inn.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter FALSTAFF and MISTRESS QUICKLY</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Prithee, no more prattling; go. I'll hold. This is</div>
                     <div class="line">the third time; I hope good luck lies in odd</div>
                     <div class="line">numbers. Away I go. They say there is divinity in</div>
                     <div class="line">odd numbers, either in nativity, chance, or death. Away!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS QUICKLY</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll provide you a chain; and I'll do what I can to</div>
                     <div class="line">get you a pair of horns.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Away, I say; time wears: hold up your head, and mince.</div>
                     <p>Exit MISTRESS QUICKLY</p>
                     <p>Enter FORD</p>
                     <div class="line">How now, Master Brook! Master Brook, the matter</div>
                     <div class="line">will be known to-night, or never. Be you in the</div>
                     <div class="line">Park about midnight, at Herne's oak, and you shall</div>
                     <div class="line">see wonders.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Went you not to her yesterday, sir, as you told me</div>
                     <div class="line">you had appointed?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">I went to her, Master Brook, as you see, like a poor</div>
                     <div class="line">old man: but I came from her, Master Brook, like a</div>
                     <div class="line">poor old woman. That same knave Ford, her husband,</div>
                     <div class="line">hath the finest mad devil of jealousy in him,</div>
                     <div class="line">Master Brook, that ever governed frenzy. I will tell</div>
                     <div class="line">you: he beat me grievously, in the shape of a</div>
                     <div class="line">woman; for in the shape of man, Master Brook, I fear</div>
                     <div class="line">not Goliath with a weaver's beam; because I know</div>
                     <div class="line">also life is a shuttle. I am in haste; go along</div>
                     <div class="line">with me: I'll tell you all, Master Brook. Since I</div>
                     <div class="line">plucked geese, played truant and whipped top, I knew</div>
                     <div class="line">not what 'twas to be beaten till lately. Follow</div>
                     <div class="line">me: I'll tell you strange things of this knave</div>
                     <div class="line">Ford, on whom to-night I will be revenged, and I</div>
                     <div class="line">will deliver his wife into your hand. Follow.</div>
                     <div class="line">Strange things in hand, Master Brook! Follow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  Windsor Park.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter PAGE, SHALLOW, and SLENDER</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, come; we'll couch i' the castle-ditch till we</div>
                     <div class="line">see the light of our fairies. Remember, son Slender,</div>
                     <div class="line">my daughter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SLENDER</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, forsooth; I have spoke with her and we have a</div>
                     <div class="line">nay-word how to know one another: I come to her in</div>
                     <div class="line">white, and cry 'mum;' she cries 'budget;' and by</div>
                     <div class="line">that we know one another.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">That's good too: but what needs either your 'mum'</div>
                     <div class="line">or her 'budget?' the white will decipher her well</div>
                     <div class="line">enough. It hath struck ten o'clock.</div>
                  </div>
